Pre-Game Insights: Sri Lanka, despite having a disappointing World Cup so far, come into this game after winning their first game against the Netherlands.
A struggling England team will hope to get their second win in the ICC ODI World Cup 2023 as they take on Sri Lanka.
The M.Chinnaswamy Stadium in Bengaluru has produced incredible batting tracks with an average score of 266.
Fast bowlers can come into play early in both innings with a new ball while spinners can pick up wickets if the ball starts gripping.
The Jos Buttler led England team is currently placed at the bottom of the table with just one win.
The English batting, the team’s biggest strength, has failed to perform with no batter seeming in any sort of form.
The bowling has continued its dismissal performance and struggled to cope up with the Indian conditions.
The Sri Lankan team has had a forgettable tournament with one win after three back-to-back losses.
The Lankans have shown flashes of brilliance but the lack of performances have cost them results.
The batting has had a few great performances but has lacked consistency.
The bowling has severely lacked control and failed to pick up wickets at regular intervals.
